page.title: 06Sandringham Kennels
page.content:
The kennels were built by King Edward VI in 1897. Originally designed to house 100 dogs, the old kennels were demolished and redesigned in 1968 to accomodate 40 dogs. Today there are about 20 dogs including 5 Labradors belonging to The Queen. Labradors and Spaniels are bred to provide working dogs for the estate's gamekeepers. The dogs can often be seen as they are exercised as a pack in the Park.
The Queen names the new puppies born at the kennels and they are registered at the Kennel Club. The Queen's great interest in the dogs has led to the breeding of four Field Trial Champions.(Sandringham Ranger, Sandringham Slipper, Sherry of Biteabout and Sandringham Sydney.) Recently, The 'Dorgi' has been bred, a cross between Dachshund and a Corgi.
